utterance.speaker: MARTHA RODGERS
utterance.content: 297 wedding guests. It’s a minor miracle. Our final total is below 300.

utterance.speaker: RICHARD CASTLE
utterance.content: There. I am done. 500 autographed copies of Wild Storm. My pre-wedding signing obligations are finished.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS CASTLE
utterance.content: Good. Now sign this.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What’s this one?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Final payment for the rooftop venue.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You mean, the perfect venue. A 360 degree view of Manhattan, the stars above us, the world at our feet. It’s too bad Beckett didn’t want to bungee jump off the side of the building for our big exit. Now that would have been cool.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: The tuxes will be in tomorrow evening. Did you tell Esposito and Ryan?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I did. They’ll be here to try them on and to collect them. You are the most adorable best man a groom could hope for.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Ah, probably the concierge with more gifts. Ah, hi, Gerard. Put them over there with the others. Thank you!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: All right, I’m out.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: ‘Bye!

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Dad, don’t forget the forms for the marriage license!

utterance.speaker: KATE BECKETT
utterance.content: Those are my case files. Ask your questions, because I will be pretty much unreachable for the next three weeks.

utterance.speaker: KEVIN RYAN
utterance.content: Okay, what are you more excited about, the wedding or the honeymoon?

utterance.speaker: JAVIER ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Three weeks in the Maldives on a private island? What do you think?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Actually, the only thing I’m not excited about is having to say my vows in front of all those people.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Oh, you’ll be fine. Just imagine your wedding guests are murder suspects.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: In their underwear.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Or not.

utterance.speaker: CAPTAIN VICTORIA GATES
utterance.content: You know, I was so nervous before my wedding that I ran into a wall and got a black eye. You’re supposed to be a wreck. You’re about to experience one of the most important days of your life. I’m so happy for you, Detective.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey guys!

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: In spite of who you’re marrying.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So … who’s ready to get her marriage license?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Me! Almost. I’ve gotta get my bag.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Excellent. And Alexis wanted me to remind you –

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: She called, she texted, and she emailed. We will be there.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: And we’ll bring our black shoes.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do you have our paperwork?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I do. I’m just practicing. I – – I do. I got it.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Have fun, guys.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: T-minus 72 hours until we are married. This feels like a dream.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s because I’m dreamy.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, shush.

utterance.speaker: CLERK
utterance.content: Next!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh. Here you are.

utterance.speaker: CLERK
utterance.content: Mr. Richard Castle and Miss Katherine Beckett.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s us.

utterance.speaker: CLERK
utterance.content: Proof of divorce?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Is – is there something wrong with my documents?

utterance.speaker: CLERK
utterance.content: They’re in order. Miss Beckett, do you have yours?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Pardon me?

utterance.speaker: CLERK
utterance.content: Your divorce paperwork.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’m sorry, there’s a mistake. I’ve never been married.

utterance.speaker: CLERK
utterance.content: Well, according to this, you have. And it looks like you still are.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’m married?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: To whom?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Rogan O’Leary? Well, who is Rogan O’Leary?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: A guy she met freshman year at Stanford.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, I think I’m going to be sick.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: And you married him?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Not really.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Except she did. The two of them drove to Vegas, had too much to drink, and thought it would be a riot to take a cab to a drive-through wedding chapel.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: You didn’t.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: She did.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, I did, but I never thought that it was for real! And I broke up with the guy a couple weeks later after I found out he was a compulsive liar, degenerate, and a thief.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes, but not before you tied the knot. And here I thought you were a one and done kind of girl.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Does your father know about this?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I really am going to be sick.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And that’ll be my lawyer.

utterance.speaker: HENRY BROWNING
utterance.content: You were both over 18. Regardless of your seriousness or intent at the time, I’m afraid your wedding at the Drive Through of Love was real, legal, and binding.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, we – – are getting married in three days.

utterance.speaker: BROWNING
utterance.content: I’m afraid you can’t. Not unless you terminate your first marriage.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We have 300 people coming, most of them are flying in. So what are we going to say to all of them?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Henry, is there anything we can do to make this go away?

utterance.speaker: BROWNING
utterance.content: It’s possible. If there’s mutual consent. I brought a dissolution of marriage contract and I could expedite it through the city, but … you’ll have to get Mr. O’Leary to sign it, too.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: How? It’s been fifteen years. I have no idea where he is.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Okay, it looks like we’ve found him, but man, is your husband a piece of work.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He’s not my husband.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Except legally he is.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So, what do we know about him?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Well, your boy got around. He was charged with theft in Austin in ’05, he did time for a DUI in ’07.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: He was arrested for fraud in Kentucky and oh, this is a good one, he was put in jail for impersonating an FBI agent in New Orleans.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I must say, given his record, I’m really surprised you stayed with him all these years.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do you know where he is now?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah. It looks like he settled in a small town in upstate New York called Willow Creek about five years ago.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do you have his contact information?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Texting right now.

utterance.speaker: OPERATOR
utterance.content: The voicemail for - Rogan O’Leary – is full. Please try again later.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’m not getting through. Either the phone rings incessantly or I get the "voicemail’s full" message.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So. What do you want to do?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I want to get married. What do you want to do?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I want to get married, too.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay! Then it’s settled. You’ll stay here and keep the wedding on track.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And … you?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’m going to go to Willow Creek. I’ve got less than three days to find Rogan O’Leary and get a divorce.

utterance.speaker: NEIGHBOR
utterance.content: He’s not worth it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Pardon me?

utterance.speaker: NEIGHBOR
utterance.content: Sweetie, I’ve been his neighbor for five years. He’s got a smile that will make your pants fall off. But trust me, he’s trouble.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do you know where I can find him?

utterance.speaker: NEIGHBOR
utterance.content: Don’t say I didn’t warn you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Excuse me. Hi. I’m looking for one of your bartenders. Rogan O’Leary?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Never mind.

utterance.speaker: ROGAN
utterance.content: Give me a break.

utterance.speaker: TILDY MCGUIRE
utterance.content: You want a break? I’ll give you a break.

utterance.speaker: ROGAN
utterance.content: What did I do?

utterance.speaker: TILDY
utterance.content: What did you do? How about what you didn’t do! I thought you came here to apologize! To tell me how sorry you are. But no. All you want is your stuff back? It’s not even your stuff!

utterance.speaker: ROGAN
utterance.content: It’s our stuff. And – and I need it to make things right.

utterance.speaker: TILDY
utterance.content: I’m through. Now get out of my bar.

utterance.speaker: ROGAN
utterance.content: Come on, babe. You know you don’t mean that. You love me too much.

utterance.speaker: TILDY
utterance.content: How’s that for love?

utterance.speaker: ROGAN
utterance.content: Kit-Kat? Is that you?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hello, Rogan.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So … I see you haven’t changed.

utterance.speaker: ROGAN
utterance.content: Oh, what? That? Nah. Come on. That was just a – ah – a lover’s quarrel, as they say.

utterance.speaker: ROGAN
utterance.content: So, Kit-Kat, what brings you to Willow Creek, huh? You walking the nostalgia trail, tracking down old flames to discover who you really are?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Ah … no. Do you remember a trip that we took to Vegas?

utterance.speaker: ROGAN
utterance.content: Ah … I don’t know. It’s a little fuzzy. But most of my best memories are.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So when we were there do you recall a cab ride and a drive up chapel?

utterance.speaker: ROGAN
utterance.content: Nope, but I do recall a dine and dash on the Strip. Huh? Do you remember that, with the hoagies?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Um, well, you know, you’re probably going to find this funny, but as it turns out … you and I have been married for fifteen years.

utterance.speaker: ROGAN
utterance.content: Married?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mmhmm.

utterance.speaker: ROGAN
utterance.content: For realsies?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: ROGAN
utterance.content: That is hilarious. How long have you known that?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well … I just found out. But you know what? It’s not a big deal because all you have to do is – – sign this and you’re off the hook.

utterance.speaker: ROGAN
utterance.content: Yeah, yeah, yeah. You know, it’s a – it is a pretty nice hook, you know? I mean heck, we have been married this long. Maybe we should just give it a chance. No, I know, I know. So uh … it must be pretty important to you to have me sign these forms, then huh? You know, if you’ve driven all the way from –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: New York.

utterance.speaker: ROGAN
utterance.content: New York. Let me guess. Lawyer.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Detective.

utterance.speaker: ROGAN
utterance.content: Detective!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah. NYPD.

utterance.speaker: ROGAN
utterance.content: Wow! So tell me, how does a girl go from picking the lock on Pearl Jam’s tour bus so she can steal Eddie Vedder’s jean jacket to becoming a cop?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh … you know, I’m sorry. You’re obviously busy and I should probably just go, but if you could just sign this –

utterance.speaker: ROGAN
utterance.content: No, yeah. Of course. Look, yeah. I would – I would really love to sign this dissolution of marriage agreement for you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Great.

utterance.speaker: ROGAN
utterance.content: But – you’re going to have to do something for me, first.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Okay, which one?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: The easy one. Which is this one. Thank you. Any news from Beckett?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Uh … she texted me a couple of hours ago. She said she found him, but I haven’t heard from her since.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Maybe they’re catching up.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Sure. No, sure. They’ve got a lot in common. She can talk about all the people she’s put in prison, and he can talk about all the people he’s met in prison.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Um … Alexis? I haven’t gained this much daddy weight.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: That can’t be right. I double checked the size ten times.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hey, maybe you finally hit that growth spurt you’ve been waiting on, bro.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh. And that’s her. Hey, what’s up?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, so, there has been a little glitch.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He won’t sign?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh no, he’ll sign. But he wants me to do something first.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What kind of thing?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He wants me to break into his ex-girlfriend’s truck and steal a garage door opener.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay … why?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Apparently after they broke up his ex-girlfriend took a few of his things and he wants them back.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And he needs the garage door opener to get into her place.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Her mom’s place, but yeah.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, given his record why doesn’t he just steal it himself?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Because her truck is parked right outside of her bar. And he can’t get close to it without someone spotting it and then telling her.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And you’re actually thinking about doing this?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: If I don’t he won’t sign. Castle, he could drag this on for years.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And if you get caught?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I won’t. Look, Castle, he’s got me over a barrel here. If I don’t do this we don’t get married.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Just get this over with and come home.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’ll call you when I’m done.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mission accomplished.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So you got the remote?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yes. And I wasn’t caught.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And you’re sure he’ll sign the papers now?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, he’s going to sign them, all right. I’m not taking no for an answer. Tell everyone that this wedding is on. I’ll be on my way back to the city soon.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Can’t wait.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Bye.

utterance.speaker: THUG
utterance.content: Get back here, Rogan!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Rogan! Hey, hey! Hey! Hey! Stop!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: DEPUTY
utterance.content: Did you get the license of the truck?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It didn’t have one. But both of the men were wearing masks.

utterance.speaker: DEPUTY
utterance.content: And your friend that got taken, what’s his name?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Rogan. Rogan O’Leary.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What? Why are you closing your notebook?

utterance.speaker: DEPUTY
utterance.content: Ma’am, the department doesn’t have the resources to investigate every claim involving Mr. O’Leary.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: But someone took him.

utterance.speaker: DEPUTY
utterance.content: I’m sure they did. I’m sure they had a very good reason. And in a few days he’ll show up drunk, bruised, and sorry as hell.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I don’t have a few days. I need to find him now.

utterance.speaker: DEPUTY
utterance.content: Ma’am, from one woman to another … let him go.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He’s been abducted? How – how? But you –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I know. I don’t believe it either.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay, okay, I hate to ask, but do you think maybe we should postpone?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, no. I’m not giving up. I’m going to find him.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, I’m a detective. Someone here has to know something.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You shouldn’t be doing this alone. I’m coming up there.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Are you sure?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes, absolutely. Everything here is completely under control. I will see you in a few hours. ‘bye.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hello? Yes, this is Richard Castle. What?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: We lost our venue? How’s that even possible?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: They had a circus party there tonight with some first time fire breathers and now our rooftop venue does not have a floor.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: This is a disaster.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I have no place to get married and no one to get married to. I think disaster is an understatement.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: So called disaster is merely opportunity in disguise. We’ll just find another place to hold the wedding.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Are you kidding? Where are we going to find a venue in Manhattan that holds 300 people? In less than two days.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Oh! We already have one. Not in Manhattan. We can move the whole party to our house in the Hamptons.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes. Yes! We’ve held larger parties than this out there.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: We rent luxury buses to shuttle the guests and pay the vendors' transportation costs.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Brilliant. I will call the housekeeper first thing in the morning and have them start getting the place ready.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You really think we can pull this off?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh, please. I once staged A Chorus Line on a subway platform when our company lost its space. I think I can move a wedding. Alexis will help with everything. You just make sure Katherine finds that deadbeat husband of hers. Yes!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Thanks for coming up, babe. I’m so sorry about this whole mess.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, what’s a fiancé for if not to help find his future wife’s current husband? And Alexis and Mother will get far more done without my interference.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I just hope that all their work is not for nothing.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You think Rogan’s ex will be able to help us find him?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: They lived together. If we’re lucky she’ll be able to tell us what kind of mess he was mixed up in.

utterance.speaker: CLORIS MAGUIRE
utterance.content: Can I help you?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh .. hi, ma’am. NYPD. We’re looking for Rogan O’Leary.

utterance.speaker: CLORIS
utterance.content: Well if you find him you can keep him.

utterance.speaker: TILDY
utterance.content: Stop it, mama. You were in the bar yesterday.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, I was hoping that Mr. O’Leary could help us with … an old case, but it seems that he was abducted last night.

utterance.speaker: TILDY
utterance.content: By who?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We were hoping you could tell us.

utterance.speaker: CLORIS
utterance.content: Wasn’t me. I’d’ve offed him.

utterance.speaker: TILDY
utterance.content: Mama, that’s enough.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Look, he was taken by two men in a rusty pickup truck. Do you have any idea who they were?

utterance.speaker: TILDY
utterance.content: No. But he’s always working crazy angles, pissing people off.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Is that why you left him?

utterance.speaker: TILDY
utterance.content: No. I was used to that. But he took money from me for one of his schemes. Said he was going to make us rich. He lost it all, of course. And now I might lose the bar. The thing is, in spite of it all … I love him. I mean, I can overlook the fact that he’s not a regular job kind of guy or that he can’t marry me while his wife’s in a coma – – but he should have never put my bar in jeopardy.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’m sorry, he said that he had a wife?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: A wife in a coma.

utterance.speaker: TILDY
utterance.content: Yeah. He married in college, she got in an accident. Been in a coma fifteen years. Katie … something.

utterance.speaker: TILDY
utterance.content: It’s kind of tragic, really.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So very tragic.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So um … did he mention any trouble yesterday? Or say anything about you having something in your possession that he urgently needed? Something in the garage or house?

utterance.speaker: TILDY
utterance.content: Actually, yeah. He said he needed the laptop I took from his apartment. Said he needed it right away.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Did he say why?

utterance.speaker: TILDY
utterance.content: No, but since it’s my laptop I figured it was a line of bull. That he wanted me to give it up so that he could sell it for the money.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Given how anxious he was to get his hands on it it might have something to do with his abduction.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Tildy, could we borrow that laptop? It might help us find him.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We are trained professionals. And Rogan might be in some very, very serious trouble.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He’s in trouble all right. I mean, all these years he knew that we were married. He knew when I got here. And for fifteen years he’s been using that as an excuse not to commit.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Coma wife. It’s kind of brilliant.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You mean despicable, right?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, that’s what I meant.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did you find anything on the laptop?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Their emails to each other are fairly pornographic but nothing that would get a man abducted.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know what? Maybe we should call Tory and have her access it remotely and see if we’re missing anything.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And we should recheck Rogan’s apartment, see if there’s anything there that can tell us what he was involved with.

utterance.content: Not necessarily.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: From Pastor Bob.

utterance.speaker: ROGAN
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: A $25,000 apology for scamming that money from you. He says if he never sees you or those photos again, you’re even.

utterance.speaker: TILDY
utterance.content: Rogan? What the hell? I told you, I never wanted to see you in here again.

utterance.speaker: ROGAN
utterance.content: Tildy, Tildy. Wait. Just … I got some bad news. My wife? That was in a coma? She died.

utterance.speaker: TILDY
utterance.content: Oh, my God.

utterance.speaker: ROGAN
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: TILDY
utterance.content: Oh, I’m sorry. I’m so sorry.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Don’t be. She’s in a much better place.

utterance.speaker: ROGAN
utterance.content: She – she left me some money and I just … I want to give it to you. God, I love you, Tildy.

utterance.speaker: TILDY
utterance.content: I love you too.

utterance.speaker: TILDY
utterance.content: Oh … come with me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I can’t believe you gave him the money from Pastor Bob.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m a sucker for happy endings. Let’s get the hell out of this town and go get our own.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yes. We’re getting married!

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: People are starting to arrive. Are you ready?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Almost! How did you pull this off?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Well, you know. I called your dad and he said you had a dress you could wear.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Wow. You look like an angel.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Yeah. For a second there, I wanted to marry you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, just stop, Lanie!

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: I must say, your mother had great taste.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Yes, she did. Look at you. I believe you are the most beautiful bride I have ever seen.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Thank you, Martha.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Lanie, darling, could you just give us a minute?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Oh, sure. I’ll just tell your dad that it’s perfect.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Thanks, Lanie. Martha, I just wanted to tell you how grateful I am to you and Alexis for … for putting this all together.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: And I want to thank you, for making my son so very happy. I brought you something. In case you didn’t have something blue.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, wow. They’re … beautiful.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: They were given to me by my mother to wear on my wedding day and by her mother before. Only women of substance have worn these gems. They’ve been waiting, Katherine. For you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’m so honored, Martha, thank you.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh darling, they’re exquisite on you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, excuse me. It’s him!

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Well, I will leave you to talk to your groom. I’ll be outside.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey, lover. How close are you?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Twenty minutes. And you’ll be happy to know things went smoothly with the judge. You are a free woman.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: But not for long. I’ve got our marriage license in my pocket and I will be there soon. And Kate?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I love you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I love you, too.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: It’s been an hour already and the natives down there are getting restless.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Where do you think he is?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I don’t know. When I spoke to him last he said he was less than 20 minutes away.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: This is Richard Castle. Leave me a message.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Straight to voicemail.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hello? Yes, this is she.
